questions.question: Which page replacement algorithm is based on the concept of replacing the page with the least number of future references?
If a system uses a 32-bit virtual address space and a page size of 8 KB, what is the number of bits used for the page offset?
What is the effect of increasing the size of the TLB?

options.A: Decreases the number of page faults
options.B: Increases the time to access memory
options.D: Increases the size of physical memory

questions.question: In the Round-Robin scheduling algorithm, what happens if the time quantum is set too high?

options.B: It leads to reduced CPU utilization
options.C: It may cause starvation of some processes

questions.question: Which of the following is a technique used to handle page faults by swapping pages between disk and memory?
In file management, what is the purpose of the Master File Table (MFT) in NTFS file systems?
Which process synchronization primitive allows a process to enter a critical section without blocking if it's available, or it blocks if it's not available?
What is the primary purpose of memory segmentation in memory management?

options.C: To divide memory into logical address spaces

questions.question: In CPU scheduling, what is the main goal of the Earliest Deadline First (EDF) algorithm in real-time systems?

options.C: To meet deadlines for time-critical tasks
options.D: To minimize the number of context switches

questions.question: What is the primary function of an indirect block in file management with respect to file data storage?

options.D: To track file location on disk

questions.question: In deadlock detection, what is the purpose of a resource allocation graph?

options.C: To visualize the execution order of processes

questions.question: What is the primary function of the Buddy System in memory allocation?

options.A: To allocate memory blocks of various sizes

questions.question: In the context of process management, what is the main purpose of a spinlock?

options.B: To allow processes to spin in a loop

questions.question: What is the main goal of the B-tree file system in disk management?
In memory management, what is the primary function of the TLB (Translation Lookaside Buffer)?
What is the primary purpose of the inode in UNIX file systems?
In the context of file management, what is the main function of the open file table?

options.D: To track file location on disk

questions.question: What is the primary objective of a message-passing communication mechanism in synchronization?
In memory management, what is the role of a TLB miss handler?

options.B: To fetch a page from disk

questions.question: What is the main goal of the Scanline Polygon Fill Algorithm in graphics processing?

options.C: To fill in the interior of polygons
